instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.R7051: What is R7051? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7052: What is R7052? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7022: What is R7022? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 16v
threads.message:
Liquid Damaged <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light, no fan spin. I cleaned up corrosion around <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> , LCDS connector, <CHIP>U5400</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q5300</TRANSISTOR>, <TRANSISTOR>Q4262</TRANSISTOR> was corroded and replaced from donor board,  a few misc caps and resistors replaced due to corrosion (mostly around <CHIP>U5400</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q5300</TRANSISTOR>).

Plugged back in and got Green light and Fan Spin, That means I am done right Louis?

I put the logic board back into chassis and ran ASD which failed with "SMC IO failed" on test Th1H.

I checked <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and discovered its 12.2V. Reflowed the SMC and now <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 16V???

I removed F7040 so I could take some measurements around <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> and MOSFETS without the 16V causing damage, but with F7040 removed <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 12.50V

Any thoughts anyone?

Thanks

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 16v
threads.message: Put back F7040 and measure again. 16V will not cause damage on PPBUS. Also check sense resist circuits for <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 16v
threads.message:
Sense circuits look good bottom <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR> <RESISTOR>R7052</RESISTOR> is 3.4Ohm, from <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR> to <RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR> is 21 ohm.

I was measuring around PPBUS MOSFETS and magically <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> went to 12.68, so I hit all the points I was measuring with solder and Reâ„œ the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>

All is good now ASD passed 

Thanks
